edu.iu.dsc.tws.dataset.partition

Class BufferedCollectionPartition<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.iu.dsc.tws.dataset.partition.CollectionPartition<T>
      • edu.iu.dsc.tws.dataset.partition.BufferedCollectionPartition<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataPartition<T>, java.io.Closeable, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DiskBackedCollectionPartition, HDFSBackedCollectionPartition

    public abstract class BufferedCollectionPartition<T>
extends CollectionPartition<T>
implements java.io.Closeable
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BufferedCollectionPartition(long maxFramesInMemory, Config config)
      Create a disk based partition with default buffer size(10MB) and without a MessageType If MessageType is not defined, it will assume as ObjectType.
      BufferedCollectionPartition(long maxFramesInMemory, Config config, java.lang.String reference) 
      BufferedCollectionPartition(long maxFramesInMemory, MessageType dataType, Config config)
      Creates an instance with default bugger size 10MB

      Creates an instance of BufferedCollectionPartition
      BufferedCollectionPartition(MessageType dataType, long bufferedBytes, Config config)
      Creates an 100% disk based instance.
      BufferedCollectionPartition(MessageType dataType, long bufferedBytes, Config config, java.lang.String reference)
      Loads an disk based partition from file system.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BufferedCollectionPartition

        public BufferedCollectionPartition(long maxFramesInMemory,
                                   MessageType dataType,
                                   long bufferedBytes,
                                   Config config,
                                   java.lang.String reference)
        Creates an instance of BufferedCollectionPartition
        Parameters:
        maxFramesInMemory - No of frames(elements) to keep in memory
        dataType - MessageType of data frames
        bufferedBytes - amount to buffer in memory before writing to the disk

      • BufferedCollectionPartition

        public BufferedCollectionPartition(long maxFramesInMemory,
                                   Config config)
        Create a disk based partition with default buffer size(10MB) and without a MessageType If MessageType is not defined, it will assume as ObjectType. This will make serialization and deserialization inefficient.
        Parameters:
        maxFramesInMemory - No of frames(elements) to keep in memory

      • BufferedCollectionPartition

        public BufferedCollectionPartition(long maxFramesInMemory,
                                   Config config,
                                   java.lang.String reference)

      • BufferedCollectionPartition

        public BufferedCollectionPartition(long maxFramesInMemory,
                                   MessageType dataType,
                                   Config config)
        Creates an instance with default bugger size 10MB
        Parameters:
        maxFramesInMemory - No of frames(elements) to keep in memory
        dataType - MessageType of data frames

      • BufferedCollectionPartition

        public BufferedCollectionPartition(MessageType dataType,
                                   long bufferedBytes,
                                   Config config)
        Creates an 100% disk based instance. This mode will not keep any data frame in memory
        Parameters:
        dataType - MessageType of data frames
        bufferedBytes - amount to buffer in memory before writing to the disk

      • BufferedCollectionPartition

        public BufferedCollectionPartition(MessageType dataType,
                                   long bufferedBytes,
                                   Config config,
                                   java.lang.String reference)
        Loads an disk based partition from file system. This mode will not keep any data frame in memory.
        Parameters:
        dataType - MessageType of data frames
        bufferedBytes - amount to buffer in memory before writing to the disk
        reference - Partition reference

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        This method will clear the memory components of this partition by assigning buffer to null and making it garbage collectible. This partition shouldn't be used after disposing.

      • clear
